In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text, r"\s+"))
    lines = []
    
    current_line = join(words[1:min(2, length(words))))], " ")
    while length(current_line) <= text_width
        push!(lines, current_line)
        if endof(words) == min(2, length(words))))
            break
        end
        words = words[2:end]
        current_line = join(words[1:min(2, length(words))))], " ")
    end
    
    current_line = join(words[1:length(words))], " ")
    
    if length(current_line) > text_width
        lines[end] *= " "
        push!(lines, current_line)
    else
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return "\n".join(lines)
end
```
Here's an example of how to use this function:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut non risus facilisis, blandit est ac, dignissim ligula. Nullam cursus ultricies tellus, id fermentum neque fringilla."

result = wrap_string(text)
println(result)
```
This will output the text wrapped to fit within the specified `text_width`.
